.. _`bio/vg/index/gcsa`:

VG INDEX GCSA
=============

Build GCSA index for variation graphs.


Example
-------

This wrapper can be used in the following way:

.. code-block:: python

    rule gcsa:
        input:
            vgs=["x.vg", "c.vg"]
        output:
            gcsa="index/wg.gcsa"
        params:
            "-Z 3000 -X 3"
        log:
            "logs/vg/index/gcsa/wg.log"
        threads:
            4
        wrapper:
            "0.75.0-772-g3f7df6e90/bio/vg/index/gcsa"

Note that input, output and log file paths can be chosen freely.
When running with

.. code-block:: bash

    snakemake --use-conda

the software dependencies will be automatically deployed into an isolated environment before execution.

Software dependencies
---------------------

* ``vg==1.27.0``

    __author__ = "Ali Ghaffaari"

    from snakemake.shell import shell

    log = snakemake.log_fmt_shell()

    shell(
        "(vg index -g {snakemake.output.gcsa} --threads {snakemake.threads}"
        " {snakemake.params} {snakemake.input.vgs}) {log}"
    )
